page.title: 03 Holywell Row
page.content: This village of less than 100 houses, derives its name from what was the largest well, which was known as the Holy Well. We could not find out much about the Holy Well except that it was used for Christenings and was situated near to one of the oldest houses called {Quaker's End},probably on the site of the {Methodist Chapel}. The village has changed very little over the past 50 years. Many of the residents are connected with farming and there is a large {chicken farm} and an {egg farm}. The area Undertaker also lives in this village and it is here that there is a Chapel of Rest. Most of the houses lie on either side of The Street and vary in age from over 500 years old to modern bungalows. {Holywell Farm} at one end of The Street has a Suffolk Barn dating back to 1776.
